info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued August 29 at 3:06AM MDT until August 30 at 1:00AM MDT by NWS Glasgow
info.description: .Strong winds developing ahead of a frontal passage will quickly lead to gusty conditions this afternoon that will grow stronger into the evening. When combined with current dry fuels explosive fire growth may be possible. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 3 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 1 AM MDT WEDNESDAY FOR DRY FUELS AND GUSTY WINDS FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 134, 135, 136, AND 137. The National Weather Service in Glasgow has issued a Red Flag Warning for dry fuels and gusty winds, which is in effect from 3 PM this afternoon to 1 AM MDT Wednesday. * AFFECTED AREA...Fire Weather Zone 134 Northern Valley and Northern Phillips Counties, Fire Weather Zone 135 The Little Rockies, Fire Weather Zone 136 The Lower Missouri River Breaks including the Charles M Russell National Wildlife Refuge and Fire Weather Zone 137 Southern Petroleum and Southern Garfield Counties. * TIMING...This afternoon into early morning Wednesday. * WINDS...Southeast 15 to 30 mph with gusts up to 45 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 15 percent. * TEMPERATURES...In the lower 80s. * IMPACTS... A combination of dry fuel and very gusty winds will lead to the potential for explosive fire growth.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in these areas of this Red Flag Warning.
